newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat ends higher in short-covering rally.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat ends higher in short-covering rally.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat futures ended higher in a short-covering rally that was sparked by a surge in CBOT soybeans, soymeal and corn, traders said.
Traders said CBOT grains were boosted by talk of either Japanese or Chinese interest in soymeal, and by bullish reports emerging from the annual corn and soybean crop tour.

"The meal pit took off. That sparked a short-covering rally in here late. Volumes were so light that we were able to come off our lows and end firm," a trader said. "Otherwise this was a very dull session."
Wheat had been adrift at the midsession, pressured by dull exports and spillover weakness from CBOT soybeans and corn.
Traders said Refco bought at least 1.2 million December bushels. Farmers Commodities Corp. bear-spread 500,000 Dec/Sept at three cents per bushel, they said.
KCBT wheat ended steady to 3-1/2 cents per bushel higher, with Sept up two cents at $4.81-1/2. December gained 1-1/2 cents to end at $4.78 per bushel.
